article.headline: Portland St. 67, Idaho St. 65
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Paul Hafford came off the bench to score 21 points, including six 3-pointers, and Portland State beat Idaho State 67-65 Saturday night. David Schroeder led Idaho State with 21 points in the loss. The Bengals lost to Weber State at home on Thursday and missed a chance to take control in the Big Sky Conference race. Ryan Sommer hit two free throws with 25 seconds to go to give Portland State a 66-65 lead. Idaho State's Matt Stucki was then fouled and had a chance to give the Bengals the lead with 3.4 seconds remaining, but he missed both free throws. Idaho State (10-11, 5-3 Big Sky) raced out to 6-0 lead, but made just 6 of 27 shots in the first half and Portland State (14-9, 5-5) held a 27-21 halftime lead. Portland State opened the second half with a 15-3 run to extend its lead to 42-26 with 16 minutes left. Idaho State responded with a 15-2 run over the game's next six minutes to get within 44-39. Portland State stretched the lead back to 53-42 thanks to a trio of 3-pointers by Hafford, but a three-point basket by Schroeder with 4:58 left capped off a 14-3 run by Idaho State and tied the score at 56-56.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
